page.title: 15Recreation
page.content: There is an area designated for recreational purposes in the Staffordshire Southern area plan, but so far it has not been possible to purchase the necessary land. A small playing field to the side of the school is for joint use, public and school, and is used on Summer evenings by young people for games. There is a very small amount of fishing in the Little Aston Hall lake and Mill Farm pond. For sports enthusiasts there are clubs for bowls, tennis and cricket in Summer, and table tennis in Winter. The Gardening Guild has a best kept village gardens competition annually. Little Aston has a first class golf course to the west of Little Aston Hall.
